itemDescription: Catholic priest who remained on board the RMS Titanic as it was sinking

wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Roussel Davids Byles (26 February 1870 – 15 April 1912) was an English Catholic priest who was a passenger aboard the RMS Titanic on its maiden voyage when it sank after striking an iceberg during the night of 14–15 April 1912. He was reported as being amidst the throng of trapped passengers on the ship's rear deck in its final moments of descent, audibly praying.

response: * James Lancaster as Father Thomas Byles: Second-class passenger Father Byles, a Catholic priest from England, is portrayed praying and consoling passengers during the ship's final moments.

There is a memorial window to Father Thomas Byles in St Helens Catholic Church. He was parish priest in Chipping Ongar from 1905 and perished on the Titanic in 1912, refusing to leave in a lifeboat and staying to pray with the remaining passengers.
*Thomas Byles – English priest who stayed on board the sinking RMS Titanic hearing confessions
* Thomas Byles: priest who died serving others on the RMS Titanic
